intro: Phyllanthus carmenluciae, commonly known as the Carmen Lucía plant, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with unique morphological features. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, waxy leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial shade. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
